title: Hubble investigates a magnetar’s birthplace
summary: Researchers using the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope have discovered that the magnetar SGR 0501+4516 was not born in a neighbouring supernova as previously thought. The birthplace of this object is now unknown, and SGR 0501+4516 is the likeliest candidate in our galaxy for a magnetar that was not born in a supernova. This discovery was made possible by Hubble’s sensitive instruments as well as highly accurate reference data from the European Space Agency's Gaia spacecraft.

title: Latitude Secures France 2030 Funding to Build Reims Factory
summary:
The French government has awarded Latitude funding to assist with the construction of its new rocket factory in Reims. Founded in 2019, Latitude is developing a two-stage rocket called Zephyr, designed to deliver payloads of up to 200 kilograms to low Earth orbit. title: Maryland congressmen vow to block proposed NASA science budget cuts
summary:
Members of Maryland’s congressional delegation expressed confidence that Congress will ultimately reject sharp cuts in NASA science programs proposed by the White House, citing competition with China as one factor.
The post Maryland congressmen vow to block proposed NASA science budget cuts appeared first on SpaceNews.
